meanings.definition: The unit of pressure in the International System of Units (SI), equal to one newton per square meter.
meanings.sent1: He measured the tire pressure in pascals before the long drive.
meanings.sent2: The weather report mentioned the air pressure in pascals for the upcoming storm.
meanings.sent3: The balloon popped with a loud bang, releasing all its pascals at once.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was so high, it felt like a million pascals pressing down on us.
meanings.sent5: The scientist explained the concept of pascals using a simple analogy with a balloon.

meanings.definition: A measurement of pressure or stress.
meanings.sent1: The doctor checked his blood pressure in pascals to ensure he was healthy.
meanings.sent2: The bridge was designed to withstand extreme pascals from heavy traffic.
meanings.sent3: She felt the pascals of stress building up as the deadline approached.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the world seemed to rest on his shoulders, each pascal heavier than the last.
meanings.sent5: The pascals of anxiety squeezed her chest, making it hard to breathe.
